channel.title: ATI Drivers in Linux
channel.description: Ok well I don't have a fucks clue why I'm doing it, but I am installing linux on my new build; I am using Ubuntu studio. I figure that my Radeon 5850 drivers aren't going to be installed by default so how do I go about installing ATI Drivers in ubuntu, or will Ubuntu automtically detect it and prompt be to download the appropriate drivers?

item.dc:creator: @CoonHunter CoonHunter
item.description:
@CoonHunter wrote:

[quote=“mwiebelhaus, post:7, topic:354427”][quote author=Moparisthebest link=topic=450998.msg3306693#msg3306693 date=1281715538]

I was doing something in a new version of Ubuntu the other day and it automatically detected drivers for my 5850’s and sorted that for me. So it should for you.

Alright thanks. It popped up in the proprietary drivers window, I haven’t installed it yet because it wouldn’t detect my windows 7 partition and im trying to dual boot

Detect it how? Windows 7 isn’t going to show up on the boot screen until you install it. Dual booting isn’t a problem at all, Ubuntu is built for it.
[/quote]

When it got to the partitioning, the partioner didn’t detect my windows 7 parition because the windows 7 paritioner is shit and does a crappy job at modifying the mbr so when the ubuntu partitioner went to look for other os’s it wasn’t finding it.[/quote]
No guarentee’s but try to partition the HDD without a OS CD, but something like Euses partition manager or something. I had the same problem with my laptop.
http://www.partition-tool.com/
